title: Algebra 2 – 100 Question Problem Set (Set B)
notes: Upgraded from v1.0 to the shared-concepts schema. Each question now uses: concept (key), difficulty (1–5), and tags (array). Display names are provided by data/concepts.json.

questions.question: If f(x)=3x-2, find f(5).
If g(x)=x^2+1, find g(-3).
What does f(2)=7 mean in words?
questions.answer: When the input is 2, the output is 7

questions.question: State the domain of f(x)=1/(x-4).
State the domain of f(x)=√(x+7).
State the range of f(x)=x^2.
State the range of f(x)=-x^2.
Is f(x)=x^2 invertible over all real numbers?
How can f(x)=x^2 be restricted to make it invertible?
questions.answer: Restrict domain to x ≥ 0 or x ≤ 0

questions.question: Find the inverse of f(x)=2x-7.
If f(x)=x+1 and g(x)=x^2, find (f∘g)(x).
If f(x)=2x and g(x)=x-3, find (g∘f)(x).
What is f(f⁻¹(x)) for any invertible function f?
Determine if f(x)=x^2 is even, odd, or neither.
Determine if f(x)=x^3 is even, odd, or neither.
What symmetry does an even function have?
What symmetry does an odd function have?
Find the average rate of change of f(x)=x^2 from x=2 to x=5.
What does average rate of change represent graphically?
questions.answer: The slope of the secant line

questions.question: How can you tell from a graph if a function is linear?
questions.answer: The graph is a straight line

questions.question: Identify the parent function of y=(x-3)^2.
Identify the parent function of y=|x|+4.
Describe the transformation from y=x^2 to y=(x+2)^2.
Describe the transformation from y=x^2 to y=3x^2.
Describe the transformation from y=x^2 to y=-x^2.
What is the shape of the graph y=|x|?
What happens to y=|x| when multiplied by -1?
What is a piecewise function?
questions.answer: A function defined by different rules on different intervals

questions.question: If f(x)={x+1 for x<0; x^2 for x≥0}, find f(-4).
Using the same function, find f(3).
How many x-intercepts can a quadratic have at most?
What does the discriminant tell you?
Why are projectile motion problems quadratic?
questions.answer: Because vertical motion involves squared time

questions.question: How many x-intercepts can a 5th-degree polynomial have at most?
What determines the end behavior of a polynomial?
Which grows faster: x^3 or 2^x?
What does a growth factor of 1.05 represent?
What does a decay factor of 0.8 represent?
Write a model for y=200(1.1)^t and explain what it represents.
questions.answer: Initial value 200 growing 10% per time unit

questions.question: Why are exponential models used for population growth?
questions.answer: Growth is proportional to current size

questions.question: What does log_b(x)=y mean?
What is the inverse of y=2^x?
Why must logarithm inputs be positive?
Do logarithmic functions grow quickly or slowly?
Why are logarithmic scales used for earthquakes or sound?
questions.answer: They compress large ranges of values

questions.question: What is the parent function of y=√x?
Why does y=√(x-3) start at x=3?
questions.answer: Values less than 3 make the radicand negative

questions.question: Describe y=√(x+4)+2.
How are y=x^2 and y=√x related?
questions.answer: They are inverses with domain restrictions

questions.question: Why must radical equation solutions be checked?
What causes vertical asymptotes in rational functions?
What causes holes in rational functions?
What determines horizontal asymptotes?
questions.answer: Comparing degrees of numerator and denominator

questions.question: What does it mean if degrees are equal?
questions.answer: Horizontal asymptote equals ratio of leading coefficients

questions.question: What happens if numerator degree is less than denominator?
Is the sequence 2, 5, 8, 11 arithmetic or geometric?
Is the sequence 3, 6, 12, 24 geometric or arithmetic?
What operation defines an arithmetic sequence?
What operation defines a geometric sequence?
What type of graph does an arithmetic sequence form?
What type of graph does a geometric sequence form?
When should you use a linear model instead of exponential?
When should you use an exponential model?
What does a positive correlation mean?
questions.answer: As one variable increases, the other tends to increase

questions.question: What does no correlation mean?
What is the purpose of regression?
questions.answer: To model data with a function

questions.question: What does slope represent in a linear regression?
What does the base represent in exponential regression?
What is an outlier?
questions.answer: A data point far from the general trend

questions.question: How do outliers affect regression models?
Which grows faster for large x: x^2 or x^3?
Which grows faster for large x: x^5 or 3^x?
How do you graph an inverse function?
What test determines if a graph has an inverse?
What does failing the horizontal line test mean?
What does it mean for a function to be continuous?
Are polynomials continuous?
Are rational functions continuous?
What happens to f(x)=1/x as x approaches 0?
questions.answer: The function grows without bound or decreases without bound

questions.question: What does asymptotic behavior describe?
What does the y-intercept represent in a real-world model?
What does slope represent in a linear model?
Why is domain often restricted in real-world problems?
questions.answer: Negative or unrealistic values may not make sense

questions.question: Why might range be restricted in modeling?
Why are functions useful in modeling?
What does a steep slope indicate?
What does a flat line indicate?
What does a decreasing function mean?
What does an increasing function mean?
What does a turning point represent?
questions.answer: A change from increasing to decreasing or vice versa

questions.question: How do you graph y > 3x - 2?
How do you graph y ≤ x^2?
What does the intersection of two graphs represent?
What does no intersection mean?
What does infinitely many intersections mean?
What does independent variable mean?
What does dependent variable mean?
Why should models be validated?
questions.answer: To ensure they fit the data appropriately

questions.question: Why might a model fail outside its data range?
What is the main goal of Algebra 2?
questions.answer: To understand and model relationships between quantities
